verses.text: Through desire a man, having separated himself, seeketh \add and\add* intermeddleth with all wisdom.
A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that his heart may reveal itself.
When the wicked cometh, \add then\add* cometh also contempt, and with ignominy reproach.
The words of a man's mouth \add are as\add* deep waters, \add and\add* the well-spring of wisdom \add as\add* a flowing brook.
\add It is\add* not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow the righteous in judgment.
A fool's lips enter into contention, and his mouth calleth for strokes.
A fool's mouth \add is\add* his destruction, and his lips \add are\add* the snare of his soul.
The words of a tale-bearer \add are\add* as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.
He also that is slothful in his work is brother to him that is a great waster.
The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
The rich man's wealth \add is\add* his strong city, and as a high wall in his own conceit.
Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honor \add is\add* humility.
He that answereth a matter before he heareth \add it\add* , it \add is\add* folly and shame to him.
The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity; but a wounded spirit who can bear?
The heart of the prudent getteth knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.
A man's gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him before great men.
\add He that is\add* first in his own cause \add seemeth\add* just; but his neighbor cometh and searcheth him.
The lot causeth contentions to cease, and parteth between the mighty.
A brother offended \add is harder to be won\add* than a strong city: and \add their\add* contentions \add are\add* like the bars of a castle.
A man's belly shall be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth; \add and\add* with the increase of his lips shall he be filled.
Death and life \add are\add* in the power of the tongue: and they that love it shall eat the fruit of it.
\add Whoever\add* findeth a wife findeth a good \add thing\add* , and obtaineth favor from the LORD.
The poor useth entreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.
A man \add that hath\add* friends must show himself friendly: and there is a friend \add that\add* sticketh closer than a brother.
